storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive notifications for schedule changes to stay informed and adjust plans accordingly

testCases.title: Validate notification sent on schedule change
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling system is operational and accessible
Email, SMS, and in-app notification services are configured and active
Test scheduler has valid email address and phone number registered
At least one schedule entry exists in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling module and select an existing schedule entry
steps.expectedResult: Schedule entry details are displayed with edit options available

steps.action: Update a schedule entry by modifying the date, time, or resource assignment
steps.expectedResult: System saves the changes successfully and displays confirmation message

steps.action: Verify that the system detects the change and triggers notification process
steps.expectedResult: System detects the schedule change and initiates notification generation within seconds

steps.action: Check the registered email inbox for notification
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received containing accurate schedule change details including old values, new values, timestamp, and change initiator

steps.action: Check the registered phone for SMS notification
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification is received with concise schedule change summary and reference number

steps.action: Check the in-app notification center within the application
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification appears in the notification center with complete schedule change details and acknowledge option

steps.action: Click on the acknowledge button in the in-app notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification is marked as acknowledged, acknowledgment timestamp is displayed, and notification status changes to 'Read'

steps.action: Navigate to notification logs or audit trail section
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgment is recorded in the system logs with scheduler name, timestamp, and notification ID

postconditions: Schedule entry is updated with new values
Notifications are delivered via all three channels (email, SMS, in-app)
Acknowledgment is logged in the system
Notification status is marked as acknowledged
Audit trail contains complete notification delivery and acknowledgment records

testCases.title: Verify retry mechanism on notification failure
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role and administrative access to notification settings
Scheduling system is operational
Test environment allows simulation of notification delivery failures
Access to notification logs and monitoring dashboard is available
At least one schedule entry exists for modification

steps.action: Configure the test environment to simulate notification delivery failure for email service
steps.expectedResult: Email service is set to reject or timeout notification requests

steps.action: Update a schedule entry to trigger notification
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change is saved and notification process is initiated

steps.action: Monitor the notification delivery process in real-time
steps.expectedResult: System attempts to send notification and encounters delivery failure

steps.action: Observe the retry mechanism activation
steps.expectedResult: System automatically initiates first retry attempt after initial failure

steps.action: Continue monitoring for subsequent retry attempts
steps.expectedResult: System performs second and third retry attempts with appropriate intervals between retries

steps.action: Access notification logs from the system dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Notification logs display all retry attempts (initial attempt plus 3 retries) with individual timestamps and failure reasons

steps.action: Restore email service to normal operation
steps.expectedResult: Email service is now accepting notification requests

steps.action: Verify if notification is delivered after service restoration during retry window
steps.expectedResult: Notification is successfully delivered on one of the retry attempts, or final failure is logged if all retries exhausted

steps.action: Review final notification status in logs
steps.expectedResult: System logs show either successful delivery with retry count or permanent failure status after 3 retry attempts

postconditions: All retry attempts are logged with timestamps and status
Notification is either successfully delivered or marked as permanently failed
System maintains data integrity despite delivery failures
Email service is restored to normal operation
Audit trail contains complete retry history

testCases.title: Ensure notifications are sent within SLA
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling system is fully operational with normal load
All notification channels (email, SMS, in-app) are active and responsive
System clock is synchronized and accurate
Access to system logs and performance monitoring tools is available
Multiple schedule entries exist for testing

steps.action: Record the current system timestamp as test start time
steps.expectedResult: Baseline timestamp is captured for SLA measurement

steps.action: Update the first schedule entry and record the exact modification timestamp
steps.expectedResult: First schedule change is saved with timestamp T1 recorded

steps.action: Update the second schedule entry and record the exact modification timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Second schedule change is saved with timestamp T2 recorded

steps.action: Update the third schedule entry and record the exact modification timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Third schedule change is saved with timestamp T3 recorded

steps.action: Monitor notification delivery for the first schedule change
steps.expectedResult: Notification for first change is received within 5 minutes of T1

steps.action: Monitor notification delivery for the second schedule change
steps.expectedResult: Notification for second change is received within 5 minutes of T2

steps.action: Monitor notification delivery for the third schedule change
steps.expectedResult: Notification for third change is received within 5 minutes of T3

steps.action: Calculate the delivery time for each notification by comparing modification timestamp with delivery timestamp
steps.expectedResult: All three notifications show delivery time of less than or equal to 5 minutes (300 seconds)

steps.action: Access system logs and filter for the test period
steps.expectedResult: System logs display all notification events with timestamps

steps.action: Review logs for any delays, errors, or warnings during the notification delivery process
steps.expectedResult: No delays beyond 5-minute SLA are recorded, no critical errors are logged, and all notifications show successful delivery status

steps.action: Generate performance report for the notification delivery times
steps.expectedResult: Report confirms 100% compliance with 5-minute SLA for all tested notifications

postconditions: All schedule changes are successfully saved
All notifications are delivered within the 5-minute SLA
System logs contain complete delivery timeline for each notification
No performance degradation or errors are recorded
SLA compliance is documented and verified

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to customize notification channels for schedule changes to receive alerts via my preferred method

testCases.title: Validate saving and updating notification preferences
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
User has existing notification preferences configured in the system
Notification preferences UI is accessible from user settings
User has valid email address and phone number registered
All notification channels (email, SMS, in-app) are operational

steps.action: Navigate to user settings or profile section
steps.expectedResult: User settings page is displayed with navigation options

steps.action: Click on notification preferences or notification settings option
steps.expectedResult: Notification preferences UI is displayed showing current preferences with checkboxes or toggles for email, SMS, and in-app notifications

steps.action: Review the currently selected notification channels
steps.expectedResult: Current preferences are clearly indicated with checked boxes or enabled toggles matching the saved preferences

steps.action: Deselect one currently enabled channel (e.g., uncheck email notification)
steps.expectedResult: Checkbox or toggle changes state to indicate deselection

steps.action: Select a previously disabled channel (e.g., enable SMS notification)
steps.expectedResult: Checkbox or toggle changes state to indicate selection

steps.action: Click the Save or Update button to save the new preferences
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message confirming preferences have been saved, and UI reflects the updated selections

steps.action: Navigate away from the preferences page and return to verify persistence
steps.expectedResult: Updated preferences are still displayed correctly, confirming they were saved to the database

steps.action: Trigger a notification event by updating a schedule entry
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change is saved and notification process is initiated

steps.action: Check only the selected notification channels for notification delivery
steps.expectedResult: Notification is received only via the newly selected channels (SMS and in-app), and NOT via the deselected channel (email)

steps.action: Verify the deselected channel did not receive notification
steps.expectedResult: Email inbox shows no new notification for the schedule change, confirming preference is respected

postconditions: Notification preferences are updated and saved in the database
Notifications are delivered only via selected channels
Preference changes are logged in the system audit trail
User interface reflects current saved preferences
No notifications are sent to deselected channels

testCases.title: Verify validation of invalid channel inputs
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Notification preferences UI is accessible
Email and SMS channels require contact information input
System has validation rules for email format and phone number format
User has permission to modify notification preferences

steps.action: Navigate to notification preferences UI
steps.expectedResult: Notification preferences page is displayed with input fields for email and phone number

steps.action: Enable email notification channel and enter an invalid email address (e.g., 'invalidemail.com' without @ symbol)
steps.expectedResult: Email input field accepts the text entry

steps.action: Click Save or move focus away from the email field to trigger validation
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message indicating invalid email format (e.g., 'Please enter a valid email address')

steps.action: Verify that preferences are not saved with invalid email
steps.expectedResult: Save operation is blocked and error message remains visible, preferences remain unchanged

steps.action: Enable SMS notification channel and enter an invalid phone number (e.g., '123' or 'abcd1234')
steps.expectedResult: Phone number input field accepts the text entry

steps.action: Click Save or move focus away from the phone field to trigger validation
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message indicating invalid phone number format (e.g., 'Please enter a valid phone number')

steps.action: Verify that preferences are not saved with invalid phone number
steps.expectedResult: Save operation is blocked and error message remains visible, preferences remain unchanged

steps.action: Correct the email address to a valid format (e.g., 'scheduler@example.com')
steps.expectedResult: Email validation error clears and field shows valid state indicator

steps.action: Correct the phone number to a valid format (e.g., '+1234567890' or '(123) 456-7890')
steps.expectedResult: Phone number validation error clears and field shows valid state indicator

steps.action: Click Save button with all valid inputs
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the inputs, saves preferences successfully, and displays confirmation message

steps.action: Verify that the corrected contact information is saved
steps.expectedResult: Preferences page shows the updated valid email and phone number, confirming successful save

postconditions: Invalid inputs are rejected and not saved to the database
Valid inputs are accepted and saved successfully
User receives clear validation error messages for invalid inputs
System maintains data integrity by preventing invalid contact information
Validation events are logged in the system

testCases.title: Ensure immediate effect of preference changes
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
User has existing notification preferences configured
Notification preferences UI is accessible
All notification channels are operational and ready to deliver
At least one schedule entry exists for triggering notifications
System is configured for real-time preference updates

steps.action: Navigate to notification preferences UI
steps.expectedResult: Notification preferences page is displayed with current settings visible

steps.action: Note the currently enabled notification channels (e.g., email and in-app are enabled, SMS is disabled)
steps.expectedResult: Current preference state is clearly visible and documented

steps.action: Change notification preferences by disabling email and enabling SMS
steps.expectedResult: UI reflects the selection changes with email unchecked and SMS checked

steps.action: Click Save button to update preferences
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message confirming preferences are saved immediately without delay

steps.action: Record the exact timestamp when preferences were saved
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is captured for verification of immediate effect

steps.action: Immediately navigate to the scheduling module without logging out or waiting
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling module is displayed and ready for interaction

steps.action: Trigger a notification event by updating a schedule entry within seconds of saving preferences
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change is saved successfully and notification process is initiated

steps.action: Monitor notification delivery across all channels
steps.expectedResult: Notification delivery process begins immediately after schedule change

steps.action: Check SMS channel for notification delivery
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification is received with schedule change details, confirming newly enabled preference is active

steps.action: Check in-app notification center
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is received, confirming this channel remains active as per updated preferences

steps.action: Check email inbox to verify no notification was sent
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is received, confirming the disabled preference took immediate effect

steps.action: Review notification delivery logs
steps.expectedResult: Logs show notification was sent only to SMS and in-app channels, with no attempt to send email, confirming immediate application of updated preferences

postconditions: Notification preferences are updated and active immediately
Notifications are sent according to the updated preferences without delay
No caching or delay affects preference application
System logs reflect the preference change timestamp and subsequent notification delivery channels
User experience confirms real-time preference updates

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view notification history for schedule changes to track past alerts and responses

testCases.title: Validate access to notification history
preconditions: User has valid scheduler credentials
Notification history database contains test data with at least 50 notification records
Test notifications include various types: schedule changes, acknowledgments, and alerts
Export functionality is enabled in the system
User has appropriate permissions to access notification history

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter valid scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the scheduler dashboard

steps.action: Locate and click on the 'Notification History' menu item or navigation link
steps.expectedResult: Notification history page loads and displays a list of past notifications with columns for date/time, notification type, content preview, and acknowledgment status

steps.action: Verify that notification records are displayed with all required fields: timestamp, notification content, acknowledgment status, and recipient information
steps.expectedResult: All notification records show complete information in a structured table or list format with proper formatting

steps.action: Click on the filter dropdown and select 'Acknowledged' status filter
steps.expectedResult: The notification list refreshes and displays only notifications with 'Acknowledged' status

steps.action: Clear the status filter and enter a search term in the search box (e.g., specific date or keyword from notification content)
steps.expectedResult: Search results are displayed showing only notifications matching the search criteria, with matching text highlighted

steps.action: Apply multiple filters simultaneously (e.g., date range filter and notification type filter)
steps.expectedResult: Filtered results display notifications that match all applied filter criteria

steps.action: Click on the 'Export' button and select export format (CSV or PDF)
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears with format options and confirmation button

steps.action: Confirm the export action and wait for file generation
steps.expectedResult: File downloads successfully to the default download location

steps.action: Open the exported file and verify its contents
steps.expectedResult: Exported file contains all visible notification records with correct data matching the displayed information, including all columns and proper formatting

postconditions: User remains logged in to the system
Notification history page remains accessible
Exported file is saved in the download folder
No data modifications have occurred in the notification history database
Applied filters can be cleared to return to full list view

testCases.title: Verify access control enforcement
preconditions: Test environment has multiple user roles configured (scheduler, non-scheduler, guest)
Unauthorized test user account exists without scheduler privileges
Authorized scheduler user account exists with proper permissions
Role-based access control (RBAC) is enabled in the system
Notification history endpoint requires authentication and authorization

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter credentials for an unauthorized user (non-scheduler role)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to their appropriate dashboard based on role

steps.action: Attempt to access the notification history page by entering the URL directly or clicking on the navigation link if visible
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and an appropriate error message is displayed: 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view notification history' or similar message

steps.action: Verify that the user is redirected to an error page or their default dashboard
steps.expectedResult: User is redirected away from the notification history page and no notification data is visible

steps.action: Attempt to access the notification history API endpoint directly using browser developer tools or API client
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Log out from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to the login page

steps.action: Log in with valid scheduler credentials that have proper authorization
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler user is successfully authenticated and redirected to the scheduler dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the notification history page using the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted and the notification history page loads successfully displaying notification records

steps.action: Verify that all notification history features are accessible (filters, search, export)
steps.expectedResult: All functionality is available and operational for the authorized scheduler user

postconditions: Unauthorized user access attempt is logged in security audit logs
Authorized scheduler user has full access to notification history
No unauthorized data exposure has occurred
System security controls remain intact
Access control rules are enforced consistently

testCases.title: Ensure performance of notification history queries
preconditions: Notification history database contains at least 10,000 notification records for performance testing
User has valid scheduler credentials with access to notification history
System performance monitoring tools are available to measure response times
Pagination is configured with default page size (e.g., 50 records per page)
Network conditions are stable for accurate performance measurement

steps.action: Log in as a scheduler user and navigate to the notification history page
steps.expectedResult: User is authenticated and redirected to the scheduler dashboard

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab to monitor API requests
steps.expectedResult: Network monitoring is active and ready to capture request/response times

steps.action: Click on the 'Notification History' link to load the notification history page with large dataset
steps.expectedResult: Notification history page loads and displays the first page of results

steps.action: Measure the API response time for the GET /notifications/history request in the Network tab
steps.expectedResult: Response time is under 2 seconds, and the first page of paginated results (50 records) is displayed correctly

steps.action: Verify that pagination controls are displayed showing total pages and current page number
steps.expectedResult: Pagination controls show correct total count and page navigation options (Next, Previous, Page numbers)

steps.action: Click on the 'Next' button to navigate to page 2 of the notification history
steps.expectedResult: Page 2 loads within 2 seconds showing the next set of notification records

steps.action: Measure the response time for the page 2 request in the Network tab
steps.expectedResult: Response time remains under 2 seconds with no errors or timeouts

steps.action: Navigate to a middle page (e.g., page 50) by entering the page number or clicking multiple times
steps.expectedResult: Target page loads successfully within 2 seconds displaying correct notification records

steps.action: Navigate to the last page of results using the pagination controls
steps.expectedResult: Last page loads within 2 seconds showing the remaining notification records

steps.action: Apply a filter to the large dataset and measure the query response time
steps.expectedResult: Filtered results are returned within 2 seconds with pagination applied to filtered data

steps.action: Perform a search query on the large dataset and measure response time
steps.expectedResult: Search results are displayed within 2 seconds with matching records highlighted

steps.action: Verify that no errors, timeouts, or performance degradation occurred during navigation
steps.expectedResult: All page loads completed successfully without errors, and UI remains responsive throughout testing

postconditions: All performance metrics are documented and meet the 2-second requirement
Pagination functionality works correctly across all pages
Database queries are optimized and indexed properly
No memory leaks or performance degradation observed
User remains logged in and notification history page is still accessible
